comments.commentBody: Yes, it was on the easy side.  After the first two I realized that part two of each theme answer would be an irregular past tense verb.  That made the rest too easy.

Trump is deranged, but he is who he is, speaks his mind without a filter and thus comes across as "authentic" or at least refreshing. There is so much anger in this country right now that any candidate singing in the vitriolic key will gain an audience, no matter the content. Bernie Sanders is the coherent version on the left. People are pissed off at income inequality and do-nothing politicians, so they respond to Trump's accurate assessment of them as 'losers.' And compared to the rest of the Republican field, who's views are just as extreme and misogynist, he's technicolor entertaining and they're black and white boring. I say enjoy Trump's happy warrior routine before the Republican midgets stage his downfall and install a careful, calculating, nightmare who hides his dark heart under blandishments. (Walker and Bush come to mind).
Ha ha. I can tell from this "delicately" written column by Mo that's she's scared of being on the bullying end of Tea Rump. Not that I can blame her.

Even a blind pig finds an acorn occasionally.
The Donald is exactly right about "Jeb!"
Any voter who want to give Brother W a third term needs involuntary commitment in the nearest padded cell.

i keep thinking about how he sat there at the correpondents; dinner while obama ripped him apart. going in, somebody asked him if he thought the president would go there, and trump said, oh, no, he won't dare.
This was great. Clean, fresh favors. I'd up the vinaigrette. I felt it needed a little more. Perfect for a hot summer evening.
Now Maureen is fawning over The Donald while ripping Obama and Hillary. What has this world come to?

Trump's the best thing that's happened to the Republican Party in decades.
Now if only the Democrats can get someone as lively and interesting to run, like Howard Stern or maybe Louis CK, we'd get some real perspective on the issues.
I bet you did...

Jerk is too kind a word for Trump.  Surely he is the P. T. Barnum of our time. My only question Maureen is what does he rate you?  Would a 2 be unkind?  I digress, all this is fun.  Can't wait for him to dump the current wife and move on to something more 'presidential'.  Who could you suggest?
I refuse to read anymore Nate Silver on H. Clinton.
Dur. There is no legitimacy to this government,  Bunch of Virginia farm boy military types and wall street types sometimes fighting and we have a fake government,
If we're not communicating with terrorists or sending subversive email, we have nothing to fear if NSA is watching,, do we.
You are correct. They target us because they do not trust us. They betray us, because they do not trust us.

It's immaterial whether the AT&T or any other telecom company came forward to provide information on citizen's private life and communication to the NDA, what's crucial to democracy and constitutional governance  is the level of mutual trust between the rulers and the ruled.  For, an indiscriminate widespread spying on citizens is not only a sure sign of major trust deficit between the government and the people but also reflective of a certain crisis of legitimacy in the political system.
Something odd about 18 recommends  [@ 346 PM 8/15/15] for a refusal to read a text. Kind of medieval.
Great job getting Trump to articulate some concrete policy ideas instead of writing a puff piece!
Correction: NDA be read as NSA.

Maureen, you are the best. Haven't had as much fun reading one of your columns since you took aim at Hillary. The on line supplement of one liners is a treasure chest. Hope that makes it into the print edition as well.  And good for Donald Trump for taking your calls, and sharing lunch with you. I remember learning in Ameircan History class that New York's Al Smith was called the "Happy Warrior." Can we bring that term back for New York's own Donald Trump as well?

Not only is he a heckler and loser he's a big fat liar. Mexican rapists???? and other lies. What kind of people find this refreshing? Not very informed people. His uncontrolled rating of women. Really? Has he looked it the mirror lately? He's ugly old, sagging face which has no character - just a dull, empty face. Is proud of his disgusting faults. Really weird. Why did these women marry him? Well, of course, he's rich
If you can't compromise you should not be in politics, as nothing gets done.

Maureen Dowd is so skillful a columnist that she can even make Donald Trump seem funny and interesting.

For about the length of time it takes to read her column.
Monroe -- those immortal words were uttered by Ann Richards -- former governor of Texas -- in reference to George H W Bush -- but the line applies to all of the him, George W, Jeb and Trumpet.
In the immortal words of Molly Ivins - just like his intellectual equal George W. Bush - Donald Trump "was born on third base and thinks he hit a triple"

That is one of the most delightful columns Maureen Dowd has ever written. On point, throughly revelatory, not nasty, and quietly tells all of us that this guy would be a major tragedy as President. Give China to Icahn and maybe add Japan ?  Yikes. Trump correctly berates the heck out of overly controlled, conniving candidates for President.  Hillary reads and then disappears for 3 days- totally correct.  No candidate for President WHO GOT ELECTED has ever campaigned the way Hillary is campaigning.  A great woman candidate is gradually throwing away her candidacy.  Where is MARTIN OMALLEY ?  Does anyone know ?  Love the entertainment value of Trump's candidacy- but giving Icahn China and maybe Japan tells voters all they need to know.
Maybe he's no misogynist, just maybe – unlike most of the other GOP candidates – but he's certainly a worldclass boor. And in that respect, he exposes the GOP for what it is today.
Trump has had no comment on Obama ever since Obama dissed him at the White House a Correspondence Dinner. He knows Obama will get him back good. Talk about putting a bully in his place!

There is something refreshing about The Donald. He is who he is, and it is very entertaining to listen to him. He is not crazy, although he loves to play one on TV. He is far more alert and intelligent than George W. Bush and Ronald Reagan, so the country cannot do worse under his leadership than it did under those two Republican presidents! I liked what The Donald had to say about Vice President Biden (a loyal man). I enjoyed his reaction to George Will's article about him - I too have always considered Mr. Will a pompous ass who has great facility with the English language and possesses a phenomenal memory; a man who uses those great gifts in the service of misleading his unsuspecting readers about really important social and political matters. Good thing The Donald now feels free to attack Mr. Will.
All in all, Trump represents a good fraction of the electorate. We are better off seeing clearly what this group of voters think, than to bury our heads in the sand and pretend that these people (with their outrageous mode of "thinking" and "reasoning") do not exist. Thank you, Mr. Trump, for exposing the know-nothing wing of the Republican Party. It is sad to think that this is the Party whose first president was the unrivaled Abraham Lincoln.

One thing is for sure.......the American people are totally fed up with our run of the mill politicians from both Parties. Hence, both Trump & Sanders are soaring in popularity as they are both unconventional in their approach & style. This, in and of itself, would make for a great race. An unabashed Capitalist vs. an avowed Socialist in a titanic struggle for the Presidency and the future direction of the Country.
Can't happen? When you look at and listen to both of the presumptive front runners like Hillary & Jeb you just want to turn off the TV. Both are complete utter yawns and relics of the past. Both are drenched in payola money along with boatloads of excessive political baggage. The same holds true for most of the other candidates as well....with the exception of Dr. Carson.
The American people are sick and tired of this WWWF staged nonsense that endlessly flows from Washington DC.
At this point, I'd take either Trump or Sanders over anyone else.
